If, Bwana.title: Elektro Locution
If, Bwana.about:
Elka Bong lp release on Love Earth Music. Elka Bong (Al Margolis and Walter Wright) are joined by guests Andrea Pensado and Steve Davis



More generally noise music may contain aspects such as improvisation, 

extended technique, cacophony and indeterminacy. In many instances, 

conventional use of melody, harmony, rhythm or pulse is dispensed 

with.



Thanks Steve....
If, Bwana.credits:
released May 9, 2023
            
            Elka Bong is

Al Margolis: Roland MC 202 Microcomposer (1); Casio CZ 101 (3); electric guitar and objects (2, 4)

Walter Wright: Board Weevil, acoustic drum kit [1-4]



with

Andrea Pensado: voice and electronics (1, 2)

Steve Davis: electronics (3, 4)



Recorded during the summer of 2022

Mixed by Tom Hamilton at the Pickle Factory, NYC, Oct 21, 2022

If, Bwana.title: LR's "Air"
If, Bwana.about: The basis of this recording uses Leslie Ross’ piece “Air” from her drop by drop, suddenly cd on XI Records (and also on Bandcamp). I was practicing my reed instrument playing to this multiphonic bassoon drone, and then decided I would record (in a sort of Exquisite Corpse way) each of my wind parts (clarinet, alto clarinet, alt and tenor saxes) to Leslie’s piece, but without listening to my previous playing. The original quartet (without the bassoon recording), didn’t quite work, so I did some pitch shifting and stretching to copies of my original version, making it a 12 track version. Which still was not quite right. Long story short, this version is a wind quintet version, with Leslie’s bassoon recording added. The tenor sax track is the only original recording of mine – the rest are pitched. Stretch versions of the other tracks I played. Hopefully (a) this makes sense, (b) was worth reading, and (c) is worth listening to. Many thanks to Leslie Ross for the composition(s) and permission to use her recording in this.
If, Bwana.credits:
released November 2, 2019
                        
                    
                

                Leslie Ross: bassoon

Al Margolis: clarinet, alto clarinet, alto & tenor sax



"Air" is from Leslie Ross' 2 CD release on XI Records: "drop by drop, suddenly"

If, Bwana.title: WTF 10: Trumpet, Amplified
If, Bwana.about: This release has 3 pieces using the same material and (sort of) highlights my working method (or at least one of them). The first piece is a studio improv of my playing trumpet, using extended (or perhaps in my case, remedial) techniques, through a microphone, into 2 small amps and captured on a Yamaha digital recorder. Piece 2 is a multitracked version using Ableton Live to slightly stretch and pitch the tracks; they are then sent on their merry way by random chance. the third work takes the tracks from piece 2, where they are arbitrarily edited to get the piece down to about 10 minutes and 30 second or so - which is the length of the original solo version (which is included in each piece). Enjoy....
If, Bwana.credits:
released March 19, 2018
            
            Al Margolis (If, Bwana): Trumpet, composition, cover painting

If, Bwana.title: Bitterness Grows in the Soil of Despair
If, Bwana.about: Lately i have been working towards "no sound" - yet when i get to using the recordings i have made, the compositional process takes over. So that what was originally intended as one pass, no overdub, transformations etc, becomes in fact a "piece". So that is what these 3 works are. Still striving towards silence, yet not (if the preceding makes any kind of sense).

If, Bwana.title: Sable
If, Bwana.about:
On this recording of 3 improvised pieces, Marta Sainz vocalizes as well as performs on an amplified dan bau – a Vietnamese single string instrument. Al Margolis (If, Bwana) makes use of what he calls a “detritus box” – one side wood, one side laminate, each half amplified with contact microphones – and all manner of detritus used to make sounds, as well as alto recorder and clarinet.



Through the use of her voice and body, Sainz’s performance refers to elements of German Expressionism and the theater of cruelty of Artaud: she is seeking to emotionally shock the viewer with their own experience, without the content and performance having a specific meaning intended in itself. Margolis shows increasing clarity of vision in his work – both as a composer, and on this recording, as an improvisor.



Together, they manage to fuse beauty and terror into something truly remarkable. This recording is a very special experience for anyone willing to travel the length of a terrifying way with these accomplished and visionary performers.
If, Bwana.credits:
released November 15, 2016
            
            Marta Sainz: voice, dan bau

If, Bwana (Al Margolis): amplified detritus box, recorder, clarinet

If, Bwana.title: AAAh.....pie
If, Bwana.about: While on tour in Europe i had the opportunity to perform in Bilbao with Marta Sainz. On the same bill were AAAh. I liked their set very much - which may in fact have been their very first live performance - and when i returned home, i asked them if they would be interested in playing a piece of mine. One of the Ponzi Pieces (so named as it kind of spins itself out from previous recordings, in a potentially endless series of pieces). Which they did - and so there is them playing to the original backing track, plus a version without the backing track (that others can now use for the next version of a Ponzi Piece). And AAAh....pie - uses edited/transformed versions of their original recordings with some of my own guitar sounds added. Enjoy and many thanks to AAAh.
If, Bwana.credits:
released July 16, 2016
            
            Group "AAAh"

​Aintzane Aranguena Oar-Arteta (Voice)

Lorea Oar- Arteta (Keyboards)

Maria Seco "Tunc" (Acoustic Guitar)​
